activity.text: It’s an exceptionally rare thing – in life or in business – that you get a second chance to make another big impression. Twitter made one massive impression and changed the way we communicate. Now, X will go further, transforming the global town square.

X is the future state of unlimited interactivity – centered in audio, video, messaging, payments/banking – creating a global marketplace for ideas, goods, services, and opportunities. Powered by AI, X will connect us all in ways we’re just beginning to imagine.

replyTo.text: It’s an exceptionally rare thing – in life or in business – that you get a second chance to make another big impression. Twitter made one massive impression and changed the way we communicate. Now, X will go further, transforming the global town square.

activity.text:
Consumer AI apps are all chasing the most obvious ideas. Breakout apps don’t work that way. The technology should be invisible in the background.

The smart builders aren’t making AI girlfriends. They’re using AI bots to seed a dating app until they reach a critical mass of users
@nikitabier You recommending creating fake user accounts?

activity.text: Everyone talks about 10x engineers but the real risk for most companies is not whether you can build it, it’s if you’re building the right thing. A designer that can distill why a user is adopting and then prototype the most clear version of that insight will save you millions.
I don’t think there has ever been a time where I overpaid for a designer, as long as I knew they were the best.

replyTo.text: Everyone talks about 10x engineers but the real risk for most companies is not whether you can build it, it’s if you’re building the right thing. A designer that can distill why a user is adopting and then prototype the most clear version of that insight will save you millions.

activity.text:
Wow! I’m grateful that @ryrzny was gracious enough to hear me out and then being open to advocate for Intro. 

Thanks to @andrewchen @nikitabier and others for calling this thread to my attention. As a result, everyone in the world can now get advice from the founder of JUMP 🤯

quoted.text:
Plot twist: I signed up for Intro.

1) This won't change the time I spend paying it forward. I'll still take meetings via warm intros and well-crafted cold DMs. But this is a buy-it-now button for my attention and a quick way to get time.

2) I respect @Raadmobrem 's hustle...

activity.text:
Thr*ads will cross 100 million users by tomorrow—or over 2% of global internet users (and it’s not available in the EU yet).

If it does fail to retain users, it will be the biggest failed social app ever.

@nikitabier Seems a weird statement to point to the risk of being the biggest failure as opposed to it being the absolute fastest growing social network in history. The biggest, most successful of anything is always potentially the biggest failure, if it fails.

replyTo.text:
Thr*ads will cross 100 million users by tomorrow—or over 2% of global internet users (and it’s not available in the EU yet).

If it does fail to retain users, it will be the biggest failed social app ever.

activity.text: @mouthy I think you misread this. I’m suggesting the opposite: that failure would be unlikely with that magnitude of network effects

replyTo.text: @nikitabier Seems a weird statement to point to the risk of being the biggest failure as opposed to it being the absolute fastest growing social network in history. The biggest, most successful of anything is always potentially the biggest failure, if it fails.

activity.text: I love Twitter: you can make predictions that sound smart and go viral and then delete them when you end up being completely wrong.

The market is not realizing the value of Meta getting 100 million high-ARPU urban coastal users back on their most monetizable surface ever: a newsfeed.

activity.text: My ability to judge character (which was never that great) has completely atrophied in the 20 years I've known Jessica. I just ask her.

@paulg People in general are terrible judges of character, especially in a short time period—like in an interview or date. Their energy levels & emotional state can shape that first interaction. You can’t really get a full picture of someone until you engage with them over a few days.

replyTo.text: My ability to judge character (which was never that great) has completely atrophied in the 20 years I've known Jessica. I just ask her.

activity.text: @paulg It’s also a moving target; people change. I know bullies from high school that are now therapists (and genuinely are good at their job).

Age 0-14: Whatever, this is dumb.

Age 14-22: This is literally the war between good and evil. How can you not be involved?

Age 22-28: This is complicated. There are trade-offs to both sides.

Age +28: Whatever, this is dumb.

After 4 long years, today is my last day at Facebook.

Here’s a quick thread on everything I learned:

👇🧵

The perfect cake doesn’t exi…

The richest man in the world is a shitposting meme king.

The best performing investor of the year is posting shirtless thirst traps.

If you don’t have a sense of humor online, good luck having any success in this decade.

Facebook's hands are tied
1—High ARPU coastal users have churned; TikTok is eating their lunch
2—They can't acquire because of antitrust scrutiny
3—They can't build because founders don't want to be there
4—IDFA killed their ability to target ads
5—The metaverse is 10yrs out
RIP

Getting your app featured in a 5min segment on a national morning show with 4 million viewers: 

1000 extra downloads
Microsoft and Google will battle it out with AI search while the next generation looks up how to do their taxes on TikTok.

To show dominance, I start every meeting with “I have a hard stop in 10 minutes”

If you're a startup with less than 5 headcount, your productivity stack should be: 
An iMessage thread and a single Apple Note
If someone put a gun to my head and said to explain what web3 is, tell my parents I love them.

If you invite 10 guys to a party, 17 will will show up.

If you invite 10 girls to a party, 3 will show up.

Few understand this.
There is no group worse at buying real estate than the tech community. Just add a Nest thermostat and stage it with midcentury furniture and you can scam any FAANG engineer out of millions.
In the last 10 years, no one has ever asked what my GPA is.
Imagine being a designer at Zoom https://t.co/62NWm7I9K0

99% of Twitter users never encounter a bot. When Elon replied to one of my tweets on Saturday, I received 10,000 crypto spam notifications over the next 24 hours.

Paid verification solves a very specific problem—for a very specific user.

Twitter Growth Strategy

0-500 Followers: Reply Guy
501-2K: Niche Bangers
2-5K: Thirst Traps
5-10K: Parody News
10-25K: Cringe Threads
25-50K: Shitposts
50-75K: Fortune Cookies
75-100K: Cringe Bangers
>100K: Get Cancelled
Men, what’s stopping you from living like this? https://t.co/LqVUONaxuc
I went from insufferably pro-mask to alt-right anti-masker in like 6 months.
Whenever you’re feeling down, remember that at least you’re not the founder of a travel startup

There are two types of people in tech:

1. People who are good at “alignment”, “framing”, “scaling teams”, and “roadmapping”
2. People who ship

A lot of people are assessing Elon and Calacanis's product ideas on their merits. 
This is wrong. 
The correct lens is: this is a reality TV show of first-time social app founders and it should be consumed as a comedy.

You can tell when someone is building their first social app because it’s an app to meet people who share your interests.

They quickly find out that 99% of people don’t have “interests” and if given free time, they simply scroll through TikTok while their brain is semi-comatose.

Crypto is dead.
Stealing in SF is illegal again.
$600K engineer salary is on life support.

New normal just dropped.
Yeah the metaverse is cool, but have you ever tried sex?

There are two types of dudes in tech:

1. Married midwestern boy with 2 kids 
2. Polyamorous Burning Man guy who drinks hemp milk and microdoses psilocybin

There is nothing in between.
People making less than $150,000 should not have to pay state taxes in NY or CA. There is nothing left after rent.
Shut it down, Elon. We’ve reached peak Twitter. https://t.co/wmHkNaFXYh

My dad passed away last week at 91.
I rarely share personal things but I thought I’d share what I said at his funeral today. 
See ya on the other side, dad. https://t.co/ouQUaMPx1D

I was just held hostage by a group of Somalian pirates and learned 10 things that you can apply to Enterprise SaaS

Time for a thread 🧵👇
It’s incredible that all of us on Twitter created and successfully defused a bank run, all in 72 hours.
We will be burning copies of Chaos Monkeys this afternoon outside the Apple labor camp in the Xinjiang province. DM for details.

quoted.text: In 80 minutes, we will find out if my recently opened Snap position will lead to my house being foreclosed or me purchasing a jet.

activity.text: I have a spreadsheet of every marriage in my friend group with the ETA of their divorce.

If you’re a product manager and you’re about to be fired:

1. Add screenshot tracking to your app
2. Find out which screen gets screenshotted the most
3. Add your app logo & URL there

Congrats, you just improved your K-factor by more than any PM in your company’s history.

When Facebook acquired my 1st company, they gave me my title: product manager. So I asked—"So the guy who designs the mockups & figures out how to launch the app?"

"No you're confused—PMs don't manage products. You'll be doing slide decks & crossfunctional alignment for 4 years"
A lot of people have asked how they can invest in Gas. The easiest way to do that is to buy Meta shares, since we’ll be acquiring them soon.

Guide to valuing your company in 2021

Page with signup form: $100mil
Product but no users: $50mil
Product with users: $25mil
Product with revenue: $10mil

I cannot repeat this enough:
If your company origin story is boring, make it up. Literally everything I’ve ever said about my company was made up.

Ladies and gentlemen, after a 5-year hiatus, I am no longer a one-hit wonder.

Introducing Gas—No. 1 in the U.S. App Store https://t.co/U37bLxH4kS
https://t.co/XCo0gyNu3c

Things that don’t exist:

• “Zero to one” product manager
• Viral content marketer
• Full stack engineer
• Designer who can prototype

If you find one, don’t fuck it up because they can start their own company. They don’t actually need you.
Every 24 year old in tech has a god complex.

You can tell when someone is building their 1st social app—it's always an app to meetup w/ friends. They soon learn 2 hard lessons
1. No one wants to hangout with the friends who need the app: socially awkward 20-somethings
2. Most Americans just go to work, watch Netflix and die
Can someone make a product called HousePass where you pay $40,000 a year and then you get access to a pool of furnished 3-bedroom houses around the world that you can continuously move between?

Startup idea: 
A course on how to ask questions on Clubhouse without sharing your life story

Every seed deal I did where the founder got drunk on fundraising and then raised a massive round from Tier-1 VCs and marked me up 5x is now zero

Every seed deal I did where the founder quietly took my money, obsessed about the user, and iterated for 4 years is now a clean 10x

Reddit is the absolute fastest way to get answers to obscure question. 

In the last 6 months, I’ve had snakes identified that I found outside my house, problems diagnosed with my HVAC system, and a treatment plan created for a diseased cactus. With all responses in under 30 min.
No point in having fuck you money if you’re not gonna say fuck you

Ending the debate once & for all.

SF: Go here to make money
LA: Go here to spend money
NY: Go here to meet a girl
Miami: Go here to die

The backwards thing about “networking” in your early years is that it feels like you should connect w/ high profile, successful people. In reality, those people are so checked out & won’t be able to do anything for you. Instead, spend your time talking to new, undiscovered folks.
The best way to lose all your money is invest in a founder who is active on Twitter.
Welcome to hell. https://t.co/vTfTkGFHVE

I couldn’t raise a single dollar for the first year of my company and then someone in a Patagonia vest told me, “If you look hungry, you’ll starve.”
I closed $1 million the following week.

If you work at a big company, virtually none of your skills will be transferable to starting a company. “Waiting to get more experience” is not only a waste of time but may actually net out negative: your risk appetite, scrappiness, and foolishness will all take a hit.
Putin is a few days away from a Medium post about his team's amazing journey.
Thanks for reading.
